page.title: 10RELIGION
page.content: Our Church is very old. There was a Church in Ulceby when the first Domesday Book was written. The Church is near the school and one of the Vicars who was called Mr. Flowers, ordered our old school to be built in l84O. You can see a picture of Mr. Flowers in the Church window above the children's altar. He is at the back but you can tell who he is by his side whiskers. The spire was added later but it has been repaired lots of times. Two years ago we made some little cardboard spires to collect money to repair the spire.Â£3OO was collected and the top part of the spire was built up again. It cost more than Â£3O.OOO altogether. There is a sundial in the Churchyard but most of the grave stones have been taken up. There used to be a chimney and a boilerhouse.
